text: <@U01DF3PNCKA> What is hutk, and how can i create this. I am following this doc <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form>

<@U01D8GPG3C7> The hutk is stored in the browser cookie by the HubSpot ijavascript  ou insert in you page i think. But like the doc says it is necessary only if you want to associate the form data to the contact actuallly browsing
But iâ€™m not an hs expert and i mainly use the api and the php sdk for some backend stuff, Maybe other people on the community portal will have the information <https://community.HubSpot.com/>

hi all, hope you've had a lovely weekend :raised_hands:

<@U7SL518D6> I am wondering how these integrations work because I guess the reason why this is not in Hub API is you could have a number of "added to Y Calendar" you sync.

*Question:* got a question about engagements API - when you add an engagement is there a way to ensure that the created engagement is 'added to Google Calendar'.

*Use case:* Be able to create engagement through API, ensure "Add to Google calendar" is ticked similarly to the HubSpot UI

<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Creating-Meeting-Schedule-via-API-does-not-create-google/td-p/225987>
if anything it'd be interesting to know how this tickbox works - is there a way to add this tickbox as frontend hax (the integrations code)

Hi everyone, I'm pretty new to HubSpot and trying to get all inserts/updates/deletes to contacts via a webhook. I logged in to our company account and created a developers account to set up an app. I then created a webhook for the CRUD on contacts for that app. Editing contacts on the company account does not send data to the given callback URL, so I assume I must install the app of the developer account somehow with the company account. How can I do this?
get the list of task queues, to be able to assign task to a particular queue based on customers choice
don't worry, it is also quite possible to have bad luck with American TZs as well

Yeah, you have to see about adding the app, but for not-yourself to add the app it has to be in marketplace for security. So when doing these tricks you have to register the app into the same HubID from which you will be doing the tricks
that might not be so easy, the engagements are pretty old and need a new API
yeah, it would seem maybe that one is missing and thus making the error, maybe contacts scope is read only
